snippet: Robert A. McDonald, the former chief executive of Procter & Gamble, was criticized for moving slowly to contain costs, but many also praised his abilities for detail and operations.
abstract: Robert A McDonald, former chief executive of Procter & Gamble and Pres Obama's nominee to lead Veterans Affairs Dept, was criticized for moving slowly to contain costs at Procter & Gamble, but many also praise his abilities for detail and operations.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Robert A. McDonald, the former chief executive of Procter & Gamble, was criticized for moving slowly to contain costs, but many also praised his abilities for detail and operations.

headline.main: V.A. Nominee McDonald Faced Criticism at Procter & Gamble
headline.print_headline: Pick to Lead V.A. Faced Criticism at Company
